Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Izhar (יִצְהָר) descendant of Kohath (קֳהָת) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► opponent of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) ancestor of Korahite (קָרְחִי) clan
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans speaks softly for themselves as if thinking out load
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: to bend (one's) ear; hence: = action by which humans or deities make a conscious effort to listen to what (other) humans say
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
literally: to open up words; hence: = causative action by which humans make difficult words easy to understand

= musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing
= action by which humans or deities utter words that are often compacted and well formulated and that require wisdom to be understood

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state of an event or an object that is very difficult or painful or harmful; also used to describe the attitude or emotion in reaction to such an event
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= person who overtakes or takes advantage of another person

Node.gloss: to be surrounded (with something)|to happen in full measure
Node.definition: literally: (an activity) surrounds (someone); hence: = process by which humans undergo a certain activity in full measure
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God

= action by which humans express their pride and satisfaction about themselves, their actions, certain circumstances they find themselves in, or a deity that they consider responsible for those circumstances
= exclamation expressing grief and dismay
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a sum of money demanded or paid, either legally or illegally, in exchange for a service, or in exchange for someone's freedom or someone's life
literally: precious; hence: = state in which a condition or activity is highly appreciated or considered of high significance

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= process by which objects stop existing in this world
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
literally: to see the pit; hence: = process by which humans die

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state in which someone lacks intelligence, refinement and culture

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
= all of the people born and living at about the same time
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= state in which humans, animals, or objects stay in a certain place for an indefinite amount of time
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= process by which humans or objects are removed from existence, through death or total destruction
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which humans lack wisdom,◄ possibly due to overconfidence, ► which can manifest itself, among other things, in relying on wealth rather than on God
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God

Node.gloss: to rule|to have charge|to have dominion
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities exercise authority over (other) humans, animals, and areas, often with focus on the manner in which this is done
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= the outward, visible shape of an object

Node.gloss: to cause to waste away|to use up
Node.definition: = action by which someone causes objects to gradually lose their quality and strength

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside; ≈ associated with high status
= particle marking a proposition as contrastive, and so limiting the scope or impact of what was stated before
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= process by which humans or animals stop living

Node.gloss: to go down (to the netherworld)|to die
Node.definition: literally: to go down (to the netherworld, death, the pit, the dust, silence, etc.); hence: = process by which humans die and descend into the world of the dead
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= action by which humans perform activities with a certain amount of skill
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= group of people sharing a certain characteristic or behavior, usually in poetic texts
= indirect male progenitor
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

Node.gloss: to see the light > to live
Node.definition: literally: to see the light; hence: = state in which humans are alive

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and worthy of appreciation and respect

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= process by which humans or objects are removed from existence, through death or total destruction
